page.title: 11Restoration of Barrow School
page.content: The{Barrow School}was opened in{1716 and closed in{1943}when the boys were transferred to the present school. Behind the school are the{12 {alms-houses}which were built by the {1st Earl of Strafford}in{1696.}The {Wentworth Estate}are now completely {renovating}these{alms-houses}into old peoples homes.A man took us inside one of the{alms-houses}which was one of the first to be started on.On this house the slates have been taken off and been put back on neater to keep the rain out.Then the man took us in to one of the houses which had not been started on it had beams holding it up it smelt damp inside.The {alms-houses}and the{Barrow School}is joined together to make a square inside the square there is a big grass patch. There is an old {well}right in the middle of the square.
